page.title: 16Offwell:Farming on a Sunday
page.content: Dad and Mum wake up at 6.0 a.m. and have a cup of tea and a biscuit. Then it is off to milk the 52 friesian cows in eight units using a Fullwood machine. We get approximately 500 litres daily. We finish around 8.00 a.m. We brush down the units, then we squirt them down with the hose pipe. My brothers, Michael 12 years old, Simon 9 years old and I, James ll years old, wake up at 7.0 a.m. Simon and I take the cows to the fields around the farm. Dad scrapes the yard then he begins mowing the grass and rowing the hay. At dinner time we have roast beef with potatoes and vegetables with strawberries for pudding. Then we watch the Farming News on TV. Then Dad does some more mowing.
